title: Why does Julien Philippe hate Albanians? - Quora

response.answer_text: Why does Julien Philippe hate Albanians? I do not hate Albanians. I’m hostile to the irrendentist expression of their nationalism because I consider that it doesn’t stand on its own legs (hence, it’s lechery), and always needs someone else to play the first role in order to achieve the Albanian bidding. This, from the Ottoman era to the NATO era, passing by Austria, Italy, the Nazi Germany & even Tito through its Komintern-like policies which favored the Albanians at the expense of the Serbs in the SFR.Yugoslavia. Also, Europe being a mostly Christian continent and me being satisfied with that, the fact that most of them are Muslims, especially in Kosovo & Metohija, do not bring any positive offset to my aforementioned opinion about the expansion of Albania on actual (and formerly) Serbian lands. As for my relationship with individual Albanians, it doesn’t differ to my individual relation with various members of a given collective. If we take Quora, there’s among them : people I sincerely like and respect (Aurel & Shënd come to mind), may we disagree or even dismiss each other on many things. That’s the kind of people I’d search compromise for in order to let aside hot potatoes and “jusq’au-boutisme” just so we can enjoy a pleasant conversation & exchange of views, and along the way redemonstrate, if needs be, that we are all humans, non-withstanding the side we lean on. To reuse the words used toward me of a Bosnian Muslim I spoke with a few years ago on Quora, whatever side we might lean on, I consider them my brothers in humanity.others that I enjoy to rant with despite the irritation they cause me (like Alfred Medolli), in a ping-pong of slaps which tend to Balkan-Quora folklore.some I have no affect for but respect the will to talk in a civilized manner (even if I sometimes ignore their demand because I know exactly where the conversation will lead to considering their writings, the immense divergence of our points of view, and a personal appreciation about the way they approach topics with me (and also, by lack of time for yet another endless conversation).some I really dislike because I consider them at best mediocre liars (or also talented ones, and I somehow respect this latter bunch as much as I dislike them because they serve their cause well, whatever might be the dishonesty they use), and at worst little Nazis.some I totally despise (example given : those threatening me of death in order to fill for an instant the black-hole of their miserable existence).To make things clear, I’m culturally & socially selective & consider that each collective must have its due accordingly to its own historical merits, but I am not “racist” toward the Albanian nation, let alone Albanian individuals. Often, and non-withstanding the sincerity of my opinions, I feel bad about trash-talking the Albanian national question because I know very well that it’s not only a polity or even a national collective that I offend, but also thousands of individuals, most of them being decent beings. But sadly, the offense comes with the topic, and I won’t compromise with the topic. It’s not an easy choice, humanely speaking, but it’s the one I make. Click somewhere else, and I’m basically gone. To sum this up, no, dear Albanians, I do not hate you, nor wish 99.9% of you any harm, no more than I wish harm to 99.9% of Serbs. Actually, I have even more interest for you than I have for most nations, because you are deeply interfaced with a nation, and more broadly a region, dear to my heart & to my thoughts. That won’t make me any nicer with your national History or the troublesome or even annoying aspects of your national question, but at least, I hope it’ll clarify a bit who/what I am toward you. My problem is not with the Albanian people, but with the Albanian irredentist endeavor in the surroundings of Albania and all that makes it distasteful in my opinion.
